alert.note: Alert for Bracken; Lewis; Mason; Robertson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 03 at 5:56PM EST until February 05 at 3:00AM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Kentucky and South Central Ohio, including the following counties, in Kentucky, Bracken, Lewis, Mason and Robertson. In South Central Ohio, Adams, Pike and Scioto. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 555 PM EST, Radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Portsmouth, Maysville, Wheelersburg, Washington, West Union, New Boston, Piketon, Manchester, Vanceburg, Greenup, South Webster, Lewisburg, Rome, Camp Dix, Tollesboro, Lucasville, Clarktown and Sciotodale.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
